TopicTitle: I am full of grief and coffee

Articles.Content:
Boy, it's been a while since I last updated this thead with my goings-on. So...

We'll go with that.
Oh... whackjob, what have YOU DONE!
Oh, you found the symmetry glitch! I used to try to find that glitch and stick 50 sepratrons on things. Always amusing.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Oh... whackjob, what have YOU DONE!

Science.

Oh, you found the symmetry glitch! I used to try to find that glitch and stick 50 sepratrons on things. Always amusing.

Hah. That's exactly what that was... symmetry button bugged out, and suddenly I had 17x duplication. So I ran with it.

It's a little easier to fall into that glitch with Editor Extensions, but I've done it in the base game a few times. I consider it a feature. I've used Editor Extensions to go above and beyond 50x symmetry, which is just completely insane, but can be lots of fun.

Edited December 12, 2013 by Madrias
I can safely say that your creations are my favorite thing on the entire KSP forums.
"We're going to need a bigger VAB."

"We're going to need a bigger VAB."

Oh, you...
Outside trusscage complete. Working inner truss reinforcements. May finish before I coma tonight. Might even do a test launch. And maybe if I'm luckier than I deserve to be, she'll be in orbit.

What tha.....

where the hell is your VAB??? I can't see it through that morass yer callin a rocket!!!
Have you ever considered... building small stuff?

small

I don't think that word exists in Whackjob's vocabulary.

Inner truss reinforcements complete. Stage two of prototyping is complete. All that is left is the test launches.

4,639 parts. Subject to change via tweaking, of course.
dear god WHY!?!?! there isnt that much kethane in the entire solar system!
I challenge you to build something resembling the VAB... in the VAB (to reasonably similar scale), and then somehow manage to get it into orbit.
Bonus points if there's a rocket in the VAB that he's launching, Vexx?

I challenge you to build something resembling the VAB... in the VAB (to reasonably similar scale), and then somehow manage to get it into orbit.

The skies fell down and the mountains turned into craters as the new monster was given birth...

Edited December 13, 2013 by astropapi1

Ahahaha! Just went for a test launch. Got an error. "Too many heap sections".

Actually, I rescind that laugh. This thing might be unlaunchable.
Wait... Whackjob found the part-count limit? How many parts on that thing!?
~4,700 parts. No, that isn't the limit. I've had a 6k part one before. I think that a combo of broken symmetry plus my building style resulted in hitting the proverbial wall.

Ah. So what's the next big plan? I can't get enough of this thread, there's just too much awesome to wander through in all the crazy designs you build.

Ever considered trying to break the part count in a spaceplane? I know, I'm crazy, and I know there's likely a few reasons you stick to rockets, so it's just a curiosity.

End result: The AEIA Mk8 is lost. I cannot even load her into the VAB anymore. Even did a clean reboot, just in case. It's too much rocket for KSP.

Well, I'll hold onto it and try again when the next patch hits. Who knows?

Ever considered trying to break the part count in a spaceplane? I know, I'm crazy, and I know there's likely a few reasons you stick to rockets, so it's just a curiosity.

I've dabbled with planes, but, eh. It's just not my thing.
I understand. I'm the other way around: I love the planes, but I don't find much fun with rockets.

Have you ever considered... building small stuff?

Turn in your rockets. All of them.

You're not allowed to Kerbal anymore.

Turn in your rockets. All of them.

You're not allowed to Kerbal anymore.

Oh cmon now. Small stuff can be fun, and small is relative. Small for Whackjob is still big for the rest of us and has the ability to be ridiculously complicated (looking anyway) and functional.
